comments.author: redman
comments.content: yes!  I saw this product and had been waiting for a review of it to come out.  Can't wait toget one.

comments.author: The Gastrognome
comments.content:
Uhhh...the attachments can't go in the dishwasher?? **rummages through dishwasher and sheepishly pulls out variety of attachments**

Huh. Hasn't done any damage to mine so far!

comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content:
Yeah, if you have the kind that is enameled it can go in the dishwasher, but
the ones that are bare, non-stainless metal, can't - they will discolor and
leave marks on other stuff.

comments.author: Dana
comments.content: Oh yes, I think this is one of the greatest inventions of the 21st century!  I love mine!

comments.author: letmelissacook
comments.content: I've had mine about a month now and I absolutely love it.  I really had to adjust my Kitchenaid to make it work properly so thought it was a bust at first.  Works great now!

comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content:
That's right, as Melissa says there is a screw on the KitchenAid that may
need to be adjusted slightly to make sure the beater makes good contact with
the bowl. Looks very simple to do, but I didn't have to in my case.

comments.author: Melissa
comments.content: That is super cool! I am always stopping to scrap the bowl down.

comments.author: April in CT
comments.content: I am pretty sure I can't live without this now that I have one.  I got it a few months ago and *LOVE* it.  It sorta squeaks when I use it because of the tight fit of the rubber up against the bowl (even after adjusting), but it works like a charm!

comments.author: Maya
comments.content: I wonder if it is available online. Baking without scraping is like a dream come true for me!

comments.author: Paige
comments.content: I just ordered one of these last night!  My KA is in constant use, so I am so anxious to use it!

comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content:
The links in the article above will take you to the page on Amazon where you
can buy it online. Enjoy!

comments.author: Tiffany
comments.content: This is amazing!  Thanks so much for the tip, can't wait to get it and try it out!

comments.author: Spa Flyer
comments.content: Oh, I hate that stuff stuck in the dimple of my K.A.   I will look for this, for sure.  And I do put my attachments in the dishwasher. Oops.  I have two enameled and just one wire whisk, so I'll leave the wire whisk out next time.

comments.author: Marti
comments.content:
Yikes!  Something I'm going to HAVE TO HAVE... as soon as I get that little unemployment situation straightened out.  But thank you!  I honestly couldn't imagine buying another gadget... was very sad about that.

Now I feel much happier.  :)

comments.author: Alejandra
comments.content: You just scared me with that "attachments can't go in the dishwasher" part, but then I read your clarification about the enameled ones (which I have). This attachment looks great; I'll definitely try it out.

comments.author: gaga
comments.content: Oooh, I'm definitely tempted to get one of these!  Why didn't they come up with this idea sooner?

comments.author: Andrea
comments.content: Just to let you know you may not be able to get these much longer if at all any more.  Kitchen Aid will not value the warranty if a blade like this is used so a lot of stores are not carrying them anymore.  It is too bad because I have one and love it!!!  Although it does seem to make the motor have to work extra hard on thick doughs.  The other theory is that kitchen aid wants to make thier own.

comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content:
Better grab one while you can then. I can see the idea that you
shouldn't use it with an extremely thick dough, but for normal uses it
is the greatest thing. I bet you are right that KitchenAid is going to
try and snag the market from these little guys, it is just too good of
an invention.

comments.author: FamilyFirst
comments.content: We dont have this here in Malaysia.   Really wish someone will bring it in over here.

comments.author: The Other Tiger
comments.content: Oh, I wanted to remember to thank you for reminding me to buy one of these (and giving me to the opportunity to get it through someone I know's referral link, I hope)!  All I've made is one batch of cookies so far, but it made creaming the butter and adding the flour so, so easy.

comments.author: Makenzie
comments.content: I double checked online and all I've found is people saying the silver ones turn gray but still work. I always wash mine and have had no problems.

comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content: Yes, that's a good point - it is just a discoloration. As far as I know, it isn't making it toxic or anything, though I haven't looked into it.
